elements.title: Masurian Canal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to rumour, the Masurian Canal (abandoned lock structure pictured) was built to serve a U-boat facility?

elements.title: Bolor Ganbold (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after becoming one of the Mongolian Armed Forces' first female recruits, Bolor Ganbold is now its first female brigadier general?

elements.title: a 2023 ruling (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 2023 ruling from the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit invalidates a law preventing people from owning firearms while under restraining orders for domestic abuse?

elements.title: Mr. X (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the remake of Resident Evil 2, Mr. X walks at four times his normal speed when the player cannot see him?

elements.title: fire chief of Rome (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that no contemporary source identifies the fire chief of Rome during the Great Fire under Nero?

elements.title: Tina Brower-Thomas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that quantum materials researcher Tina Brower-Thomas's attempts at chemistry as a youth led to her concoctions eating holes into her coat?

elements.title: Džuvljarke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Džuvljarke written by Vera Kurtić includes interviews with members of the LGBT community in Serbia and concludes that Romani lesbian women are often "invisible"?

elements.title: a New Mexico TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a New Mexico TV station went on the air "a day late but ... not a single program short"?
